info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 9 at 9:50PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers and locations in Indiana...
East Fork White River near Rivervale, at Shoals, near Bedford, at Williams, and at Seymour.
White River below Eagle Valley Power Plant, near Centerton, at Newberry, Spencer, Edwardsport, and Elliston.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following river and locations in Indiana...
White River at Hazleton and Petersburg.
.Major flooding continues on the White and East Fork White rivers. The crest on the White Wednesday evening was just past Edwardsport, and forecast to reach Petersburg Friday evening and Hazleton Saturday night. Spencer is expected to fall below flood stage Thursday night, but Petersburg and Hazleton will remain above flood stage through all of next week.
The crest on the East Fork was near Williams Wednesday evening and forecast to reach Shoals Thursday night. Seymour should fall below flood stage Friday night, while points downstream will stay above flood stage until at least the middle of next week. Rainfall is expected on and off through Thursday night, but total amounts of less half an inch are not expected to raise the crest, but could lengthen the time in flood.
* WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record.
* WHERE...White River at Petersburg.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, A near record flood is in progress. Water level is at a height approached in June 2008 and exceeded in January 2005. Evacuations are necessary. River cabins are destroyed. Great damage occurs to rural county road system. SR 56 begins to flood in the Bowman area. Flooding may damage railroads. Flood waters overtop almost all levees in the Petersburg area.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EDT Wednesday /7:45 PM CDT Wednesday/ the stage was 26.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EDT Wednesday /7:45 PM CDT Wednesday/ was 26.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 27.7 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Thursday morning by around 745 AM EDT /645 AM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Daviess, IN; Gibson, IN; Knox, IN; Pike, IN
